Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; exterior: glazed streaky brown (mostly worn); reserved band around edge of rim; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd is thin and the angle is low, suggesting that it may have come from a Chalice Style patterned chalice. For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0909) (phase 2)
